Reviews.Title: “Robbed at the Convent”
Reviews.Author: Stan K
Reviews.Content: Last year when I stayed here, my room was broken into and the contents in my locked luggage was stolen. The door was jimmied open. The locks on the doors are condusive to being open with a shim. The person managing the front desk was completely unresponsive saying that "this had never happened before", but that there is nothing that they could or would do about it. It was not until an attractive young lady came to the desk to report her room had also been broken into that the gentleman at the front desk decided to pay attention to the complaints. He then called the police who did nothing. The attitude by the hotel management was "this happens" and "this is Rome." The security system at the front desk did not record any unknown persons entering or leaving the convent. And because there is only the front entrance, it could only be concluded that the robbery was done by a guest or, more likely, the staff. The staff knows who is in or out of their room since you leave your key with the front desk. I am returning to Rome this year for a few days and will not stay here again. I have found other accomodations which are better than this convent at a comparable price. I recommend that people look elsewhere to stay. Convents like this are no longer the bargain they used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: traveller65432107
Reviews.Content: We paid 90 euros per nights, a pretty good deal in the center of Rome. Plus : The hotel is 2 minutes walk from the Vatican. They offer a free breakfast. You can find a parking on the street for 8 euros per day. Minus : the beds are dirt and the walls are really thin, you can be weak up at 6 in the morning because of this. No TV in the room but who's going to Rome for listen TV?

Reviews.Title: “I adore this place! Perfect for singles, couples, and groups.”
Reviews.Author: EMajeski
Reviews.Content: Very inexpensive (around $80 a night for singes or $100 a night for doubles, etc.) and very safe feeling. I traveled there with a group from my university, but I would absolutely feel comfortable coming back here to stay by myself. The staff is so friendly here! The breakfast set-up was so great too (I'm still searching for a cup of coffee in the States that can compare to how good theirs was!) I loved how close I was to the Vatican and transportation. It's such a good home base and you can walk to Trastevere for dinner or there are some good little places to eat up the street too. Close to a couple little shops to buy necessities and things too. Really quiet on this street, which was especially good on New Years Eve. You feel far enough away from the craziness, but close enough to get to it all too. I really didn't care about the small bathrooms...considering it's Europe and my room had an actual shower with doors, I thought it was better than most. It was super neat and clean, so I was perfectly happy. I shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Yet Complete”
Reviews.Author: WendyVacaville_CA
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive hotel; satisfying breakfasts; smaller yet adequate rooms; great service; awesome location

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: MEVD
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close the the Vatican, this is the place. It is very plain since it is run by the Trinitarians, so don't expect any luxuries but it is very comfortable and clean. The room had a good size.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER TERRIFC STAY”
Reviews.Author: WANDERERSUPREME
Reviews.Content: I was the leader of a group of 25 Canadians in July 2011 and again I booked the Casa for our 8 day stay. Again, I was so impressed with the guesthouse and its staff. It is also so close to St Peter's and close to several restaurants and shops. The prices are ever so reasonable even with the exchange rate. The breakfast is included and it is not just a "continental" breakfast. There is fruit, several cereals, pastries, meats and cheese. The place remains spotlessly clean. The rooms are simple but comfortable. My group thought the Casa was excellent. Carmine and his staff are very friendly and understand English. They are incredibly helpful. As a tour leader I am impressed and will stay again with the Trinitiarian priests who operate the facility. So, group leaders contact the Casa and individuals or families...this place is best value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorAMJ
Reviews.Content: The Trinitarian Guesthouse is located just a few minutes walk from St. Peter's Square, a short walk from Trastevere and conveniently located to all major transportation. The Guesthouse is always clean, as it provides daily maid service. The staff is truly amazing, with their helpful attitude and never ending smiles. Carlo, Carmeni, Michele and others are an absolute plus for which money would not be sufficient to match their value. If you're going to room with a group, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Dwight58
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Within walking distance to the Vatican and Saint Peters. Rooms are small but have everything you need for your stay in Rome. Great Breakfast and freindly atompshere. Also, one block from public transportation that take you into the City of Rome. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location Near St. Peter's Square”
Reviews.Author: SledD0g
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in mid-January 2011 for a short Rome vacation. We loved the location because leaving each morning and returning each evening our walking route took us through St. Peter's Square - quite beautiful and only 5-10 minutes from the hotel. Very quiet, comfortable and clean room with private bath. Room was plain but that was OK, we were there to see Rome, not the room. Very good continental breakfast-different breads, cereals, cheese, excellent strong coffee. I think there were few guests during our stay. The large breakfast room may indicate it is much busier during the summer. We definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 42139Adventurer50
Reviews.Content: We returned from Rome and stayed at this monestary guesthouse. The location was wonderful with only a 10 minute walk to Vatican Square. Everyday when we walked out of the guesthouse, we were greeted by St. Peter's Basilica Dome. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is plentiful with granola, yogurt, cheeses plus good strong coffee and much more. The rooms a simply decorated as we expected at a monestary but very comfortable. The location is quiet so we were able to get a good nights sleep after a full day. I highly recommend this guesthouse if you want a good location and much value.

Reviews.Title: “A real surprise package”
Reviews.Author: wannadanz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for almost a week during October 2010 and was so surprised with the whole package for this accommodation. A single room, private bath, air cond and a fantastic breakfast cost Euro70. This is a real deal in Rome. The location alone is worth that. Everything is so close, transport, The Vatican, good restaurants. The reception staff are very friendly and will help with any details you require. WiFi is available at good rates. Don't miss this.

Reviews.Title: “NO BETTER PLACE”
Reviews.Author: WANDERERSUPREME
Reviews.Content: If you are a leader of group travel and making Rome your destination there is NO better place for your group than Santa Maria alle Fornaci which is fewer than 5 minutes from the Vatican. Restaurants and food stores are close by as is a laundrymat. An inexpensive "SKYPE" type internet phone store is a block away. This guest house has clean rooms, good showers, air conditioning and a good breakfast all included in what are EXCELLENT prices. The Trinitarian priests operate this place. There is a large room for gorup meetings, a computer for email access and a TV lounge. While the rooms are small they are comfortable. There is no curfew. The staff is warm, friendly and eager to help you. My wife and I on private visits to Rome stay here rather than a pricey Roman hotel. This place is a must and I am sure you will not be disappointed with it. A great find in Rome next to Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, simple amenities”
Reviews.Author: mjd50
Reviews.Content: If you want a simple, no frills place to stay close to the Vatican, then this is a good choice. We paid 90 euros a night, with breakfast included. The breakfast is continental but there are several choices, including pastries, cereal w/ milk, slices of ham and cheese, yogurt and fruit (apples when we were there). Coffee is excellent, served in a small pot to your table with another pot of hot milk. The rooms are of course very small, two twin beds that are relatively comfortable. I still put the extra blanket under my sheet for more cushion. The fluorescent lighting is a bit harsh, so if you want to read while your roommate sleeps, bring a reading light. The closet is large enough with hangers and 2 large drawers. Bathroom is also very small, especially the shower. If you are over 6 foot and more than say 250 pounds, then you may have trouble. The doors open inward which makes it difficult to enter/exit if you are a big person. The water was very hot though. The internet is not free. 2 euros for 30 minutes, 3 euros for an hour, but it was fast and there is a b/w printer for your use. Safety deposit box is free. Location is great, about 300 yds from St. Peters square. There are several good restaurants nearby and small shops to get any necessities. I bought a 4GB media card for 15 euros, which is way cheaper than those souvenir stands. The small pan y dolce place near the corner had great porchetta sandwiches. The 64 bus stop is at the end of the block near the tunnel or better yet, another stop is about a 100 yards up on Via Della Fornaci. The desk scheduled us a ride to the airport, which was 43 euros for two people. The showed up right on time in a comfortable mercedes van. The train ride for two people is 28 euros so may as well pay a little more for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value guest house near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Professor 1126
Reviews.Content: Casa per Ferie S. MARIA TO BRICK, Pzza. S. # 27 Maria all furnaces is a 10 minute walk to Vatican City and 5 minutes to a major Rome [ATAC] Bus Interchange. Simple, clean rooms with private baths, elevator, daily maid service and Continental Plus breakfast. Multi language front desk. Close to many neighborhood restaurants. Book early as it is often sold out. Book by FAX to [--]. I am a frequent visitor to Rome and the Vatican area and this is one of the best value holiday / guest houses in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Casa Marie...”
Reviews.Author: NandM
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Rome before and Casa Maria was the center of gravity for our explorations of the Vatican/St Peters, Piazza Navona, Trastevere, Campo Di Fiori and Forum/Palatine areas. We did choose to stay in Piazza Navona at the end of our trip but we could have easily explored all of Rome from this location. The bus station is a block or two away for transport around the city on the Red 64 bus. There is no doubt, we would stay here again. Friendly staff (especially the gentlemen that worked the afternoon/evening shift) well kept building on a peaceful street with plenty of restaurant choices whether it be a snack or a full "Cena", (dinner) there was a little of everything including a direct view of the Vatican from the doostep. The whole place has a welcoming, mellow and quiet atmosphere. Rooms were perfect. We had very comfortable twin beds, which was ample for busy days of sightseeing and sleeping like a log . Having said that, know and like the person you are sharing this room with, it's cozy in there! The tv was not missed, the room (213) had a big window with no screen that provided a great sleepy breeze at night, giving us the best sleep of our 12 day trip. Woke everyday to noticeable but not alarming church bells and relaxed in the afternoon to Italian children playing basketball in the neighboring schoolyard, both made for a great soundtrack. The bathroom is small by American standards, but more than adequate. My husband is a big guy and was comfortable in the shower. Great water pressure too which felt great at the end of long day of sightseeing. The room includes a huge armoire with drawers and a desk and plenty of accessible outlets and available WIFI access (for a fee). We found that it had everything we needed to enjoy Rome at a great value with the bonus of a cultural significance. Casa Marie serves a plentiful "colazione" or breakfast every morning starting at 7:30. Italian meats, cheeses, fruits, yogurt, granola and various cereals, biscotti and of course hot coffee. They also had these home made sourdough type biscuits that I wanted the recipe for. Will return and recommend, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in one place - with the Vatican outside the door”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoverWriter
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel and loved it. Yes, it's basic but the beds are good, the bathroom excellent, the breakfast varied and good, the desk staff are friendly and helpful ... All for a low price. What more do you need for a hotel room! We stepped outside the hotel on our first night, planning to walk to dinner, and were startled by the beauty of St. Peter's dome, exquisitedly lighted in the dark of night, just to our left. Only about 2-3 blocks away, it's a very easy walk with lots of shops, restaurants and gelaterria's nearby too. Perfect location and an excellent hotel. Can not wait to return. We actually stayed in 2005, not 2006 and I'm returning in October 2009 ... next month.

Reviews.Title: “If good service matters to you ~ go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: HaveBaggsWillTravel
Reviews.Content: I recently took a group of 28 people on a tour of Italy. We stayed the last 5 nights of the trip in Rome at this hotel. I have mixed feelings about this property. Definite pros and cons. Pro ~ The hotel was very clean. Con ~The rooms were extremely small and the bathroom was so tiny you couldn't even get the door completely open because the toilet was in the way. Pro ~ The location to the Vatican area was great. Con ~ It was quite a long way to the nearest metro stop. Pro ~ The breakfast buffet was good and the women working it were WONDERFUL. Con ~ The men working the front desk were TERRIBLE. They were usually grumpy, rude and impatient.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: tellana1
Reviews.Content: S. Maria alle Fornaci is a good budget option in Rome. Attached to a church it is religiously affiliated but is not a pilgrimage house per se---anyone can stay there. The rooms are spartan--beds, a nightstand, a lamp, no tv. Bathrooms are decently sized and worked fine. If you view your hotel as a place to sleep, it's great. They have internet access (for a fee) and the breakfast was decent--typical of the Italian hotels at which I have stayed. There is an elevator and access at night is secure--you have to be let in by the receptionist. The location is decent. It's about 3 blocks from the hotel to the Stazione San Pietro (train) and about equal distance to a bus stop. It's a longer walk to San Pietro, but once you get there there is a taxi stand and a larger bus depot across the Tiber. My father stayed here with me and is 70 and has a bad knee; he found the walk to the bus depot/San Pietro tiring but doable. As long is you are mobile it's a comfortable walk and nice to be able to stroll around St. Peter's in the evening. Definitely nothing fancy, but good for the money and a great buy for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great find near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Peggy1223
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel3 blocks form the Vatican. Rooms are basic, nice bathroom, very nice breakfast included. For a modest price, this is a great find in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely find a stone's throw from the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: ChoralScholar
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing holiday in Rome staying at this clean, mostly quiet, B&B. The breakfast was so hearty, and the staff were very helpful and accommodating. They had the quickest wait time for radio cabs. The rooms were simple, but had enough storage and closet space. We were thrilled at how close St. Peter's was. And since we were going for a canonization this was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Right where you want to be. Loved it”
Reviews.Author: gregscarp
Reviews.Content: This review is based on a stay exaclty one year ago from this writing. April 11, 2007. I was just thinking of my wonderful Rome trip and wishing we were there right now. The accomodations are clean, comfortable, and just what you need. Breakfast is included and always delicious.This is not the Hilton, nor does it need to be. You are steps away from St. Peters and in walking distance of all sites in the City. We walked everywhere with no problems. The staff is friendly, accomodating and gracious. There is no need to spend hundreds of Euros for a great stay . Ask for Carlo or Giovanni, they were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, and Spartan”
Reviews.Author: kPuffy
Reviews.Content: Convent converted into a hotel, just a couple blocks south of St Peter's Square. The rooms are basic but immaculate, comfortable, and air conditioned. No TV in the rooms, which was fine by me. Staff was very helpful and pleasant, and most spoke a good bit of English. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SharonK07
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, just a few streets from St Peters. As you would expect from a religious establishment rooms were quite small and spartan but contained all necessities. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful, staff polite and helpful, clean and overall excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “spotless, comfortable, mere steps from St. Peters”
Reviews.Author: Springers
Reviews.Content: This convent converted to a hotel is a mere two short blocks from the back of St. Peters and Vatican City. The entire atmosphere of this hotel is polite, quiet and efficient. Even the guests are considerate. Our room had two twin beds with the most comfortable mattresses I've slept on in a long while. The sheets are cotton ironed to perfection. Our French windows came with an opaque inside shutter which allowed for day sleeping in complete darkness after a long flight. The ac provided plenty of cool air even during the heat wave of July, 2006. The shower is small, but nice with unyielding hot water. It has an elevator, a computer and TV in the community room for guest use, a wonderful breakfast of gourmet cereals, fresh fruit, pastries, juice, meat, cheese, yogurt, coffee and tea. The staff is polite, English speaking and very accommodating. BUT the best thing about this hotel is its location and price. You just can not beat the proximity to the Vatican and all it has to offer for 80 euros/night. If you prefer quiet hotels, then this is the place for you. If you party all night, forget it.
